title: Michael Page vs. Derek Anderson headlines Bellator's November return to London
text:
Michael Page knew he was headlining Bellator’s upcoming show in London before the outcome of his most recent fight.

Friday, Bellator officials announced that Page (15-1 MMA, 10-1 BMMA) will take on Derek Anderson (16-3 MMA, 7-3 BMMA) at Bellator Europe 6, which takes place Nov. 23 at The SSE Arena in London.

After Page suffered his first career loss to Douglas Lima in May, “MVP” bounced back in spectacular fashion with a first-round flying knee knockout over Richard Kiely at Bellator Europe 4 in Dublin. He will be making a quick turnaround when he faces Anderson next month.

Anderson is coming off back-to-back wins over Zak Bucia and, most recently, Guilherme Bomba this past weekend at Bellator 229. It will be an even quicker turnaround for Anderson, who will be heading into hostile territory to try to put a halt to Page’s new momentum.

The Bellator Europe 6 lineup now includes:

Michael Page vs. Derek Anderson

Fabian Edwards vs. Mike Shipman

Terry Brazier vs. Soren Bak

Charlie Leary vs. Tim Wilde

Daniel Crawford vs. Robert Whiteford

Alfie Davis vs. Myles Price

Walter Gahadza vs. Lewis Long

Kent Kauppinen vs. Andy Manzolov

Denise Kielholtz vs. Sabriye Sengul

Harry Hardwick vs. Nathan Rose

Tom Mearns vs. Jeremy Petley

Damian Frankiewicz vs. Aiden Lee

Kevin Fryer vs. George Tokkos

Tom Green vs. Akonne Wanliss

‘Super’ Shane Campbell vs. Raphael Uchegbu
description: A welterweight matchup between Michael Page and Derek Anderson will headline Bellator's return to London in November.
